Articles.Content:
Hi,

before anyone says, I have searched.

The Delta-V map is excellent and I can use it to plan journeys to anywhere to or from Kerbin.

I am sure that some of the capture velocity is due to the speed I need to leave Kerbin.

What I am struggling to find is a a toll or map that can ssisst me calculating the deltaV from Low Planet Orbit to Low Other Planet Orbit for the entire system.

Can anyone advise?

Cheers,

RBS.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-31T21:19:58Z" title="03/31/2015 09:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 31, 2015</time> by rockbloodystar**
  
Answered!

Edit: Guess that didn't help. Sorry!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-31T21:08:16Z" title="03/31/2015 09:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 31, 2015</time> by Slam\_Jones**

Please read my initial post.

This tells you how to get to and from Kerbin.

It is not very accurate for a trip from Eve to Jool, say.

> 
> Google is your friend ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> (I searched "delta-v map ksp")[http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/7/73/KerbinDeltaVMap.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/7/73/KerbinDeltaVMap.png)

> 
> It is not very accurate for a trip from Eve to Jool, say.

Isn't it? You can't just add Eve-Kerbin dV to Kerbin-Jool?

> Isn't it? You can't just add Eve-Kerbin dV to Kerbin-Jool?

Well, no.

The capture Delta-V (1330 + 80) at Eve is based on the velocity you arrive from Kerbin with. It is not the equivalent of the 950 figure at Kerbin, for one example.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> [http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/](http://alexmoon.github.io/ksp/)

That appears to do the trick.

Thanks.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> That appears to do the trick.
> 
> Thanks.

And after a few tests it indeed does do the trick.

> 
> The capture Delta-V (1330 + 80) at Eve is based on the velocity you arrive from Kerbin with. It is not the equivalent of the 950 figure at Kerbin, for one example.

Oh, I see what you mean.

I always do aerocapture, so it never came up for me.
